706630f-a.text:
51-81 Schermerhorn Street, north side, between Court Street and Boerum Place. In center is the German Evangelist Church; next to it, the small building, is the Brooklyn Eye and ear Hospital, and next to it is the
Brooklyn Lodge No. 22, B.P.O. Elks.
June 11, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
706630f-a.folder: Schermerhorn Street & Court Street, Brooklyn, NY

706632f-a.text:
75-79 Schermerhorn Street, north side, between Court Street and Boerum
place, showing rear of Brooklyn Eye and Ear Hospital.
June 11, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
706632f-a.folder: Schermerhorn Street & Court Street, Brooklyn, NY

706631f-a.text:
64 Schermerhorn Street, south side, just east of Court Street, showing
St. Constantine's Greek Orthodnx Church.
April 7, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
706631f-a.folder: Schermerhorn Street & Court Street, Brooklyn, NY

706633f-a.text:
Schermerhorn Street, south side, at, adjoining and east of Court Street, also shown is Court Street, easr side, south of Schermerhorn Street. All buildings east of No. 62 which is the frame building west of St. Constantine's, Greek Orthodox Church, were still standing in 1929. The 4-story building at the extreme right, No. 111 Court Street, was also standing in that year. All other buildings between those montioned above, were demolished by the Chanin Construction Company. and a 6-story office building was erected on the
site. The new building is Nos. 101-107 Court Street.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706633f-a.folder: Schermerhorn Street & Court Street, Brooklyn, NY
